title: Luke Andrade
text:
About

Hi I’m Luke, a master’s student in statistics, aspiring statistical arbitrage researcher, and hopefully a future PhD student in statistics.
My academic interests are probability theory, stochastic processes, time series analysis, and simulations.
My current goals are to gain research experience, pass PhD qualifying exams in Summer 2025, and increase my overall mathematical maturity.
Some of my hobbies are playing video games and volleyball. Recently I’ve been playing Pokemon Go.


Education


 Rutgers University | New Brunswick, NJ

M.S. in Statistics | September 2024 - Present

Financial Statistics and Risk Management Program and Completing First Year PhD Requirements.
Current Courses: Measure Theoretic Probability (PhD), Mathematical Statistics (PhD), Applied Statistical Methods I (PhD), Foundations of Risk Management
Future Courses: Stochastic Processes (PhD), Statistical Inference (PhD), Applied Statistical Methods II (PhD), Time Series Analysis, Data Mining



B.A. in Statistics and Mathematics | September 2020 - May 2024

Minor and Certificate in Data Science
Courses: Machine Learning Principles, Probability Theory, Stochastic Processes, Mathematical Statistics, Regression Methods, Multivariate Analysis, Numerical Analysis, and Bayesian Statistics
Participated in the quantitative finance club, taekwondo club, and K-Pop dance club





Experience


 MarketAxess | Quantitative Research Intern (Python, SQL) | June 2024 - August 2024
Personal Project: I researched the effects that a trading strategy has on bond pricing, trade execution, and market impact. I also tested different benchmarks that can be used for testing such strategies and analyzed how dealers respond to these strategies.
Group Project: Other interns and I wire-framed the implementation of a pricing model into a new market and how it would benefit automation in that market. I personally analyzed the demand for automation and compared the accuracy between a proprietary model and competitor model.



 Crum & Forster | Data Science Intern (R, SQL) | May 2023 - November 2023
Research & Development Team: I worked on several projects including analysis of vendor data to find useful predictors for a pricing model, revamping of other Shiny applications to provide quality of life changes and implement new features, and developing of an API to streamline vendor data retrieval and feature engineering for use in a pricing model.
Actuarial Pricing Team: I developed an R Shiny application that calculates actuarial metrics, key performance indicators, and automates data analysis for actuaries and other insurance personnel. The application connects to several databases gets automatically updated daily with fresh data. This gives actuaries the freedom to focus on more granular levels of data instead of having to worry about data querying, cleaning, analysis, visualization, and metric calculation at the higher department and line of business levels.



  


Thanks for checking out my website!

title: Projects
text:
Genshin Impact Summoning Calculator

This probability calculator uses Monte Carlo simulations to estimate probabilities and expected values for summoning in the video game Genshin Impact. It takes several input parameters and then runs the simulations in real time to give an accurate and individualized statistics for the user.

title: Projects
text:
This probability calculator uses Monte Carlo simulations to estimate probabilities and expected values for summoning in the video game Genshin Impact. It takes several input parameters and then runs the simulations in real time to give accurate and individualized statistics for the user allowing them to assess their risk.




In this project, I wanted to build a model to predict the the price of the a certain stock. By doing this project, I was able to learn about ARIMA, exponential smoothing (Holt’s Linear Trend), and LSTM (neural network) models. Part of my analysis included checking if the time series was stationary through the ADF test, checking if residuals are white noise via the Ljung-Box test, and building models for close price (non-stationary), price difference (stationary), and returns (stationary).

title: Projects
text:
Ongoing

Machine Learning from Scratch in R
As statistics curriculum tend to focus on some theory and then application of models through functions in R (or Python), students such as myself overlook the algorithm and math that drives the functions. Through this project, my goal is to learn about all the necessary math behind the machine learning models that are taught in school and implement them in R from scratch. To do this, I am reading the free online books An Introduction to Statistical Learning and Advanced R , which has allowed me to learn more about how and why the models work, how to calculate the parameter significance, and how to program in the R6 object oriented programming framework in R.




Algorithmic Stock Trading
In this project, I am leveraging a brokerage’s API to develop infrastructure to automate trading, back-test strategies, and analyze real-time data. The goal is to have a framework where I can seamlessly implement and test any strategy as well as try to develop some strategies of my own. Currently, I am pulling daily stock data for every ticker, filtering to pairs that have large correlations, and then testing for cointegration. I will back test pairs trading on potential pairs. Unfortunately, this project is currently on hold do to lack of ram.

title: Luke Andrade
text:
Hi I’m Luke, master’s student in financial statistics. My academic interests are probability theory, stochastic processes, and Monte Carlo simulations. My career goal is to become a quantitative researcher and I am currently looking for quantitative research experience to supplement my education. My current goals are learning more about the financial markets and becoming proficient in self-learning/reading math textbooks. Some of my hobbies include playing video games, taekwondo, volleyball, and learning K-Pop dances.

Personal Project: I researched the effects that a trading strategy has on bond pricing, trade execution, and market impact. I also tested different benchmarks that can be used for testing such strategies and analyzed how dealers respond to these strategies.
Group Project: Other interns and I wire-framed the implementation of a pricing model into a new market and how it would benefit automation in that market. I personally analyzed the demand for automation and compared the accuracy between the MarketAxess proprietary model and a competitor model.
Tech: Python, SQL, AWS



Research & Development Team: I worked on several projects including analysis of vendor data to find useful predictors for a pricing model, revamping of other Shiny applications to provide quality of life changes and implement new features, and developing of an API to streamline vendor data retrieval and feature engineering for use in a pricing model.
Actuarial Pricing Team: I developed an R Shiny application that calculates actuarial metrics, key performance indicators, and automates data analysis for actuaries and other insurance personnel. The application connects to several databases gets automatically updated daily with fresh data. This gives actuaries the freedom to focus on more granular levels of data instead of having to worry about data querying, cleaning, analysis, visualization, and metric calculation at the higher department and line of business levels.
Tech: R, SQL

title: Reading List
text:
Novel Series

Re:Zero - Starting Life in Another World
Currently on Volume 21
Series about an average 18 year old who gets sent to another world but every time he dies, which happens a lot, he gets sent back in time to try again but there is a catch. He is unable to tell anyone about his power and he can’t control it either.


No Game No Life
Currently on Volume 11
Series about a bother and sister gaming duo who get sent to another world where violence is prohibited (literally impossible) and all affairs are conducted through games.


Future Series
Is it Wrong to Try to Pick up Girls in a Dungeon
The name is definitely misleading. It’s about a fantasy world where the characters go into a dungeon to get loot and level up by slaying monsters. The main character gets saved by a high level adventurer when a high level monster ended up in a low level floor. He then strives to become stronger to reach her level.
Mushoku Tensei - Jobless Reincarnation
Not entirely sure what its about yet.

title: Reading List
text:
